issues.title: Fix: 404 Page Routing Redirects to Goldydocs of Netlify Instead of Custom 404 Page
issues.body:
## Issue Description

When accessing non-existent routes on the website, users are incorrectly redirected to a Goldydocs page instead of our custom 404 error page.

### Expected Behavior
- Non-existent routes should display our custom Hebrew 404 error page
- The HTTP status code should be 404
- Users should see the message "הדף לא נמצא" with a link back to the homepage

### Current Behavior
- Non-existent routes redirect to a Goldydocs page
- The custom 404 page is not being served
- Users see unrelated content instead of the proper error message

### Root Cause
The issue stems from incorrect configuration in multiple places:
1. Missing dedicated 404 page in the Hebrew content directory
2. Incorrect Netlify redirect configuration
3. Incomplete Hugo output and page handling configuration

## Solution Implemented

### 1. Created Hebrew 404 Page
Added a dedicated 404 page in the Hebrew content directory:
```markdown
---
title: "הדף לא נמצא"
layout: "404"
---

# הדף לא נמצא

אופס! הדף הזה לא קיים. נסה לחזור אל [דף הבית](/).
```

### 2. Updated Netlify Configuration
Modified `netlify.toml` to properly handle 404 redirects:
```toml
[[redirects]]
  from = "/*"
  to = "/he/404.html"
  status = 404

[[headers]]
  for = "/*"
  [headers.values]
    X-Frame-Options = "DENY"
    X-XSS-Protection = "1; mode=block"
    X-Content-Type-Options = "nosniff"
```

### 3. Updated Hugo Configuration
Modified `hugo.yaml` to ensure proper 404 page handling:
```yaml
outputs:
  section: [HTML, RSS]
  home: [HTML, RSS]
  page: [HTML]
  404: [HTML]

disableAliases: true
```

## Testing
To verify the fix:
1. Run the site locally using `hugo server`
2. Try accessing a non-existent URL (e.g., `http://localhost:1313/non-existent-page`)
3. Verify that the Hebrew 404 page is displayed
4. Check that the HTTP status code is 404

## Additional Notes
- This fix ensures proper 404 handling while maintaining security headers
- The solution respects the site's multilingual setup with Hebrew as the default language
- The fix prevents unwanted redirects and maintains proper HTTP status codes

## Related Documentation
- [Hugo 404 Pages](https://gohugo.io/templates/404/)
- [Netlify Custom 404](https://docs.netlify.com/routing/redirects/redirect-options/#custom-404-page-handling)

issues.title: Add Community Logo as Website Favicon
issues.body:
## Description
Currently, the website doesn't have a custom favicon (browser tab icon). We should use our community logo as the favicon to improve brand recognition and provide a better user experience.

## Current State
- The website uses the default browser favicon
- We already have our logo in SVG format at `assets/icons/logo.svg`

## Proposed Changes
1. Convert the existing SVG logo to appropriate favicon formats:
   - `.ico` file (16x16, 32x32 pixels)
   - `.png` files in various sizes (16x16, 32x32, 48x48, 64x64)
   - Apple Touch Icon (180x180)
   - Other necessary sizes for different platforms

2. Add the favicon files to the appropriate directory (typically `/static/favicon/` or similar)

3. Add the necessary HTML tags in the website's `<head>` section:
```html
<link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon" href="/favicon.ico">
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" sizes="180x180" href="/apple-touch-icon.png">
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" sizes="32x32" href="/favicon-32x32.png">
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" sizes="16x16" href="/favicon-16x16.png">
```

## Technical Details
- The Hugo theme might already have a way to configure favicons - we should check the theme documentation first
- We'll need to use an image editing tool to convert the SVG to the appropriate formats
- The favicon files should be optimized for web use

## Benefits
- Improved brand recognition
- Professional appearance in browser tabs
- Better user experience across different devices and platforms

## Resources
- Current logo: `assets/icons/logo.svg`
- [Hugo Favicon Documentation](https://gohugo.io/templates/internal/#configure-faviconspng)
- [Favicon Best Practices](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/design-and-ux/browser-customization/)

issues.title: Add Comments Section to Website Pages and Blog Posts
issues.body:
## Description
Add a comments section to both website pages and blog posts to enable user engagement and discussion.

## Features Requested
- Add a comments section at the bottom of each page and blog post
- Support for user authentication (optional)
- Moderation capabilities for comments
- Markdown support in comments
- Email notifications for new comments (optional)

## Technical Considerations
- Consider using a third-party service like:
  - Disqus
  - Giscus (GitHub Discussions based)
  - Utterances (GitHub Issues based)
  - Or implement a custom solution

## Benefits
- Increased user engagement
- Community building
- Valuable feedback collection
- Enhanced user experience

## Additional Notes
- Ensure the comments section is responsive and works well on mobile devices
- Consider RTL support for Hebrew comments
- Implement spam protection measures
- Add moderation tools for managing comments

Please discuss the preferred implementation approach and any specific requirements before proceeding with the implementation.

issues.title: Issue Title: Feature Request: Members Open-Source Activity Page
issues.body:
We would like to add a new page to the Maakaf home website dedicated to showcasing the open-source activity of our members. This page will provide a centralized view of individual contributions to various open-source projects, highlighting their involvement and impact within the broader open-source community.

# Goals
- Increase visibility of Maakaf members' open-source contributions.
- Motivate members to engage more with open-source projects.
- Provide a clear overview of collective Maakaf member involvement in open-source.

# Proposed Feature: Members Open-Source Activity Page
This page will display aggregated and detailed data about each Maakaf member's activity in open-source repositories.
We'll consider a repository "open-source" if it has more than 4 unique contributors of commits directly to the project. For forked repositories, only commit contributions made to the fork itself will count towards this definition; inherited contributions from the original project are excluded.

## Data Collection & Processing:
**Source:** All data will be collected from GitHub.
**Member Identification:** Members will be identified by their GitHub profile usernames.
### Metrics to Collect per Member per Identified Repository:
- Total number of commits made by the member to the repository.
- Total number of pull requests (PRs) opened by the member in the repository.
- Total number of issues opened by the member in the repository.
- Total number of comments added by the member to PR discussions in the repository.
- Total number of comments added by the member to issue discussions in the repository.

## Data Presentation (Open to Design Ideas):
The page should clearly present the following information for each Maakaf member:

### Individual Member Profile/Summary:
- Member's Name (and potentially their GitHub username/avatar).
- Total aggregated counts across all relevant repositories for:
- Total Commits
- Total Pull Requests Opened
- Total Issues Opened
- Total Comments (sum of PR and Issue comments)
- Per-Repository Breakdown (e.g., in an expandable section or detailed view):
- List of each open-source repository the member contributed to.
For each repository, display:
Repository Name and Link.
The member's specific counts for that repository: commits, PRs opened, issues opened, PR comments, issue comments.

### Potential UI/UX Considerations (Ideas for Discussion):
**Member List:** A list of all Maakaf members, possibly sortable by total activity.
**Clickable Profiles:** Clicking on a member's name could expand to show their detailed per-repository breakdown.
**Filtering/Sorting:** Options to filter by activity type or sort members by highest contributions.
**Visualizations:** Simple charts (e.g., bar charts) to show total contributions or contribution trends over time (future enhancement).

## Technical Considerations
**GitHub API Usage:** This feature will require extensive use of the GitHub API. We will need to consider rate limits and authentication (e.g., using a GitHub App or Personal Access Token with appropriate scopes).
**Data Storage:** A mechanism to store the collected activity data to avoid hitting API rate limits on every page load. This could involve a database or cached JSON files.
**Scheduled Updates:** A cron job or similar mechanism to periodically update the data (e.g., daily, weekly) to keep it fresh.
**Frontend Framework:** Integration with the existing website's frontend framework.

## Open Questions for Discussion / Further Research:
How will we collect the GitHub usernames of Maakaf members?
What is the preferred method for authenticating with the GitHub API (e.g., GitHub App, PAT)?

issues.title: [Feature]: GitHub GraphQL Client Implementation
[Feature]: Open-Source Repository Identification
issues.body:
## Feature: Open-Source Repository Identification

## Description
Implement logic to identify open-source repositories from contribution data.

## Acceptance Criteria  
- [ ] Filter repositories with >4 collaborators
- [ ] Exclude private repositories
- [ ] Exclude personal repositories (owner matches contributor)
- [ ] Unit tests for filtering logic

## Phase 1 Implementation
```javascript
function isOpenSourceProject(repository, contributorUsername) {
  return repository.isPrivate === false &&
         repository.collaborators.totalCount > 4 &&
         repository.owner.login !== contributorUsername;
}
Test Cases

 Public repo with many collaborators → true
 Private repo → false
 Personal repo → false
 Public repo with few collaborators → false

Dependencies: GitHub API client
Estimated Effort: 1 day

issues.body:

## Description
Design and implement individual member contribution cards showing key statistics.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Display member avatar, name, and GitHub username

- [ ] List recent contributions (last 5)

## Card Content
- GitHub avatar (with fallback)
- Display name and username  
- Total contribution score
- Pull request count
- Recent contributions list
- Last activity date

## Styling Requirements
- Card hover animations
- Consistent spacing and typography
- Mobile-responsive layout
- Accessibility considerations (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)

**Dependencies**: Hugo page layout

**Estimated Effort**: 1.5 days

prs.title: Enhancement: Continued Development on Your COBOL Banking Project
prs.body:
I came across your COBOL banking practice project and really enjoyed exploring the code! I recently started learning COBOL, and your project provided a great opportunity for me to dive deeper into the language.

I forked the repository and continued developing it based on what interested me, and I wanted to share my additions with you through this pull request. I thought you might find it interesting to take a look.

Thank you for your work on this project—it has been incredibly helpful for my learning process! Let me know if you have any feedback.

Best regards,
Uriel

close #4

@precision @aborruso  @johnpaulett @rspier 
Can you help me get this PR been reviewed?
@rivka14 can you give us an update?

> 1. The start point is the users. 
You are right it should be clearer.

> 
> > Total number of commits made by the member to the repository.
> 
> I don't think we should count commits. Commits are depends on the individual developer flow, they say nothing about the quality and quantity of the contribution.
> 
> > Total number of issues opened by the member in the repository.
> 
> We should consider taking only answered issues or another check, but maybe not in the MVP.
> 

What do you think we need check if not commits?
I don't know what can give as the best view of the activity.

> ### MVP
> I think maybe we can remove more features from this plan, to make it as lean as possible (for example, count only PRs and not issues). Working in MVP strategy is very important to finish this project, and after that, adding more data and features will be easier.

We'll start and see how things are going.

היי עומרי, אחלה עבודה.
אין לי הערות ספציפיות על הקוד.
הייתי בודק האם יש דברים מובנים בDOCSY שיכולים לעבוד במקום ההגדרות הספציפיות שבנית בCSS, אני תמיד בעד להשתמש בדברים גנריים מאשר להשתמש בקוד ייחודי.

לגבי התוכן, אשמח לקצת שיפורים-
א. צריך שיופיע שם המשתמש המלא ולא התיוג שלו בגיטהאב, יש מצב שאנחנו לא מקבלים כרגע את המידע הזה מהשרת.
ב. אני בעד ששם המשתמש וכמות התרומות שלו יופיעו באמצע התא בטבלה ולא למעלה, אני בעד אמצע גם מבחינת גובה וגם מבחינת רוחב.
ג. מידע נוסף שכדאי להוסיף זה כמות הפרוייקטים בהם השתתף כל אחד.


מה דעתך?

ועוד הסבר לגבי עבודה עם פול-ריקווסט, ברגע שאתה עושה קומיט בבראנץ' שאתה עובד עליו, זה מעדכן פה את הפול ריקווסט.
אז מה שצריך לעשות כדי להתקדם זה פשוט שתמשיך לכתוב את הקוד ותעשה קומיטים.
for issue #20

היי @Omrist12 
אשמח אם תוכל לכתוב מה התוכנית שלך להמשך הפיתוח של צד הפרונטאנד של הפיצ'ר.
בינתיים קישור לתצוגה של הקומיט האחרון:
https://deploy-preview-32--maakaf.netlify.app/he/members/

> היי @UrielOfir הרעיונות העיקריים לתוספות מבחינתי הם:
> 
> * פילטור לפי פרויקט - לאפשר לחפש משתתפים בפרויקט מסוים.
> * הוספת אווטר בגיטהאב לטבלה - לשיפור תצוגה חזיתית.
> * שדרוג אפשרויות תצוגה - הוספת אופציות לכמות שורות בתצוגה.
> 
> אשמח לשמוע על רעיונות נוספים.

- איך יהיה הפילטור לפי פרוייקטים? להבנתי זה טבלה חדשה, לא ברור לי איך זה יעבוד בטבלה של חברי הקהילה.
- אווטר זה מעולה.
-לא הבנתי מה זה להוסיף כמה שורות.

משהו כללי שחשבתי עליו שאנחנו לא רוצים שבתא אחד יהיה יותר מאשר מידע על משהו אחד.
כלומר מה שכרגע נמצא בDetails יותר נכון לפרק לטורים נפרדים על כל אחד מהפרמטרים: קומיטים, PRs, אישויים וכו'.

אם אתה בעניין יש עוד דברים לעשות בפרונט:
לשפר את הסקריפט באופן כללי,
לבנות את רשימת חברי הקהילה בקובץ נפרד ממנו הסקריפט לוקח את המערך של החברים ושולח לבקאנד,
לכתוב הסבר איך להוסיף את עצמך לרשימה של חברי הקהילה שאנחנו מוציאים את המידע שלהם מגיטהאב.

הייתי חוקר מה שיטת העבודה הנכונה כדי לשמור על אחידות בין הפרונט לבק, איך עושים את זה כמה שיותר אוטומטי שהJSON שהפרונט מצפה לקבל יהיה תואם לJSON שהבקאנד שולח.
בטח יש מערכת שמאפשרת לעשות התאמה כזו ומתריעה אם יש פער.

אשמח לשמוע מה אתה חושב.

@Omrist12 
הכי קריטי לי זה שלא יהיה בתא אחד יותר מאשר מידע אחד. הטור של Details הוא בעייתי לדעתי.

לגבי פרוייקטים, כרגע אדם אחד יכול לתרום לכמה פרוייקטים, ואם אנחנו לא פותחים לכל פרוייקט שורה, מה שאומר שלאדם אחד יהיו כמה שורות, אז איך אנחנו מאגדים ומציגים על אותה טבלה את הפרוייקטים, לא ממש הצלחתי להבין.

Merging.

Rate-limit handling
* Don’t retry all 4xx. Only retry:
1. network errors (no status)
2. 5xx (500–599)
3. rate-limit/abuse (403 with remaining===0 or 429 with Retry-After).
* Don’t retry permanent errors like 401/404/403 (non–rate-limit).

Headers
*I f Retry-After present then sleep that many seconds (+~250 ms buffer).
* If X-RateLimit-Remaining === 0 and X-RateLimit-Reset present then sleep until reset (+~500 ms buffer).
* Add jitter on exponential backoff for transient errors (avoids thundering herd).

Pagination
* Wrapping octokit.paginate() in one retry means a failure on page N re-fetches from page 1. Bettersolution: use for await (const page of octokit.paginate.iterator()) and retry per page. this will help us to avoids wasted calls.
it might be useful to log how many rows were inserted per repo/event type, not just the repo count. it will help us  to monitor ingestion quality.

I thought that the decision was that silver stays in the app and not in the DB.  you created these tables in the DB. 
So I think we need to create TypeScript interfaces + zod schemas and keep Silver in memory:
1. types.ts (TypeScript interfaces (DTOs)
2. schema.ts (zod for validation),- this is optionally, we can leave it under a flag
3. mappers.ts (bronze to silver logic),

If we do want Silver in the DB now, let’s call it out explicitly and add: FKs (repoId, authorUserId, polymorphic parent for comments), indexes (repoId, authorUserId, createdAt), enums/constraints (visibility, parentType), and proper migrations (no synchronize in prod). Otherwise lets proceed with in-app DTOs + mappers only.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
There is also issue with naming consistency (plural vs singular, and CreateAt vs createdAt - but I guess this is because I wrote it that way, so I should fix this). 

Commit.pushEventId: I noticed we don't save this field. I will add it to our task list and handle this so it will be available.
